immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lothar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). Lothar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lothar is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). He regains his expended spell slots when he finishes a short or long rest. He knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Lothar can use his action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into his human form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his human form if he dies.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: Lothar can mimic simple sounds he has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Rage
entries: Lothar can enter a rage as a bonus action. His rage lasts for 1 minute. During his rage he has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. He gains a +4 bonus to damage while he is in a rage. He has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while in a rage. Lothar cannot cast spells while in a rage.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: Lothar makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

action.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage, 14 ({@dice 1d12 + 8}) while in a rage.

action.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.
